name: FurationXL
description:
UPDATE (July 19th 2025):

Released released Cherry Cream after so long and finishing the model showcase, it is seemingly from my testing really good, although it isn't perfect, it is in a state where I am happy to see others use it.

Notes:

Why do my models have Early access? Because well listen, it's hard enough training Loras and merging sdxl models takes a year even with 32gb of ram sadly, so I just do early access since it gives me a little bit more buzz I can put towards learning how the use the Civitai Lora Trainer, which is very hard to get working with a dataset over 100 images

Model Information:

A Model made as the successor to my SD1.5 model line called Furation, which was designed to mimic the same style of SD1.5 with everything from SDXL, PonyXL, Illustrious and NoobAI that makes it better than SD1.5. it's meant to have a 2.5D style by default but it can do many styles, I just personally love the 2.5D style. Please don't use the SDXL version because it sucks, but the pony and all of the Noobai/Illustrious models are really good

Prompting:

Noob:

Positive: 

masterpiece, best quality, amazing quality, very aesthetic, high resolution, ultra-detailed, absurdres, newest, scenery, furry, anthro, detailed background, detailed hair, depth of field, detailed fluffy fur, photorealistic details, volumetric lighting, BREAK

Negative: 

 human, multiple tails, modern, recent, old, oldest, graphic, cartoon, text, painting, crayon, graphite, abstract, glitch, deformed, mutated, ugly, disfigured, long body, lowres, bad anatomy, bad hands, missing fingers, extra digit, fewer digits, cropped, very displeasing, (worst quality, bad quality:1.2), bad anatomy, sketch, jpeg artifacts, signature, watermark, username, simple background, conjoined, bad ai-generated

Pony:

This model has way better prompting so using simple prompt templates like the following:

Positive:
detailed background, detailed foreground, depth of field, soft lighting, volumetric lighting, (kemono), realistic, digital media \(artwork\), commission, absurd res, BREAK

Negative:
malformed, worst quality, bad quality, (ahegao), bangs, bad eyes, messy hair,

Can produce Great results even without further prompting, But if you do want some suggestions to get even better images, Use Negative hands and Boring SDXL

Also Just use E621 Tags, you could use any Booru tags but it doesn't work as good with Booru tags..
cleaned_description: UPDATE (July 19th 2025): Released released Cherry Cream after so long and finishing the model showcase, it is seemingly from my testing really good, although it isn't perfect, it is in a state where I am happy to see others use it

name: Ecliptica-ArcaneX
description:
Disclaimer: Each version is different and this is not based on the arcane show's style and nowhere related to it.

V2.8 Settings:
Steps: 20+
CFG: 3+
Sampler: Whatever works for you.

Scheduler: Whatever works for you.

V1.0 Settings:
Steps: 25 - 30
CFG: 4 - 6
Sampler: Euler / Euler A / DPM++ 2M (Haven't tested with other samplers)
Scheduler: Normal / Karras (Haven't tested with other schedulers)

V1.5 Settings:
Steps: 25 - 30
CFG: 3.5 - 7
Sampler: Euler (Haven't tested with other samplers)
Scheduler: Normal (Haven't tested with other schedulers)

Note: You may have to regenerate with different seeds a couple of times it isn't 100% accurate, like many other models. You need proper pony scores. Positive Prompt should have "score_9, score_8_up, score_7_up" Negative Prompt should have "score_6_up, score_5_up, score_4_up".


V2.0 Recommended Settings:
Steps: 28 or higher
CFG: 4.5 or higher
Sampler: Euler (Haven't tested with other samplers)

Scheduler: Normal (Haven't tested with other schedulers)
Recommended Negative Prompt: worst quality, old, early, low quality, lowres, signature, artist name, signature, username, logo, bad hands, mutated hands, loli, shota, young, child

Note: You may have to regenerate with different seeds a couple of times it isn't 100% accurate, like many other models. (Optional): Proper pony scores. Positive Prompt should have "score_9, score_8_up, score_7_up" Negative Prompt should have "score_6_up, score_5_up, score_4_up".

V2.5 Recommended Settings:
Steps: 30 or higher
CFG: 6 - 9
Sampler: Euler (Haven't tested with other samplers)

Scheduler: Normal (Haven't tested with other schedulers)

Note: You may have to regenerate with different seeds a couple of times it isn't 100% accurate, like many other models. This Version is only 11% V1.0 - Refined, so proper pony scores is OPTIONAL: Positive Prompt should have "score_9, score_8_up, score_7_up" Negative Prompt should have "score_6_up, score_5_up, score_4_up". If it looks like it doesn't have a VAE make sure to regen it to a different seed to see if you can get it better looking or use my symphtia style lora version 6 with it.

Model is supported and on Tensor, CivitAI and PixAI.

Note: V1.0 Unrefined is highly unpredictable on tensor.

âš ï¸ IF YOU'RE GOING TO STEAL MY MODELS, MAKE IT SO THE DOWNLOAD IS ENABLED. THIS WORKS BETTER LOCALLY. - Zyrnox âš ï¸

https://pixai.art/model/1819844909782505939, https://civitai.com/models/996671, https://tensor.art/models/802153041936582220
cleaned_description: Disclaimer: Each version is different and this is not based on the arcane show's style and nowhere related to it Settings: Steps: 20+ CFG: 3+ Sampler: Whatever works for you | Settings: Whatever, Euler, 20, 25, 28 | Prompts: Prompt should have "score_9, score_8_up, score_7_up" / Prompt should have "score_9, score_8_up, score_7_up"

name: Oops! All vpred NoobAI Western 2D furry toon
description:
My attempt to make a vpred Noob-based model that doesn't suck!

Recipe: StableMondAI-SDG + Noob vpred 1.0 + some LoRA magic

I am still trying to find a good sampler/scheduler and CFG that doesn't create blurry results with darn near every vpred checkpoint, if you find that magic combo, let me know.

The best results I have found so far are Euler A/Simple and CFG 3.0

Also, gen at the standard SDXL resolutions for best results:

1024x1024

1152x896

896x1152

1216x832

832x1216

1344x768

768x1344

640x1536

1536x640
cleaned_description: My attempt to make a vpred Noob-based model that doesn't suck Recipe: StableMondAI-SDG + Noob vpred 1.0 + some LoRA magic I am still trying to find a good sampler/scheduler and CFG that doesn't create blurry results with darn near every vpred checkpoint, if you find that magic combo, let me know | Settings: 3.0, r

name: xepernoobhax
description:
This is a merge that I've made because I couldn't choose a favorite model, which has led to not being able to choose a favorite of my own models (-_0)

It's pretty good, so I'm sharing it :)
It should be good at following prompts. I've no idea how it works with LORAs or artist styles, I don't use them.

Avoid the "Bad" models. I should delete them, but I'll keep them for whoever's interested.

More info in "About this model" section. Whichever preview image has the most reactions will be the cover image...will probably end in the rich getting richer :p

ko-fi for the generous

5-7 cfg

20-30 steps

Probably any normal SDXL resolution, I use 832x1216

Positive: masterpiece, absurdres,

Negative: (bad anatomy:1.5), signature, watermark, (worst quality, bad quality:1.2),

Negative-2: sketch, worst quality, bad quality (slightly different style, may make better images/follow prompts better than negative 1.

Other styles:

Photorealistic // Flat color // Anime screenshot // 3d // Western comic /(style/) // Furry

name: zero nans
description:
Zero nans â€” Noobai-based SDXL vPred Merge

A lineart-focused, sketch-style SDXL model merge built on NoobaiXLNAIXL_vPred1, enhanced with handpicked models like AozoraXL, LHC vPred, Duchaiten Style 18 + others, and a self-trained LoRA.

(Edit: use modelsamplingdiscrete if you're using ComfyUI)

ğŸ”§ Recommended Settings

  • Sampler: Eulercfg++

  • Steps: 28

  • CFG: 1

ğŸ–Šï¸ Prompting Tips
Use Danbooru tags & artist tags, check out their wiki on https://danbooru.donmai.us/wiki_pages/help:home

ğŸ§¬ Merge Components
NoobaiXL, AozoraXL, LHC vPred, Duchaiten Style 18, DimSum, Self-trained LoRA

  • æœ¬ç³»åˆ—æ¨¡å‹ä½¿ç”¨æ ‡å‡†Danbooruæ ‡ç­¾ï¼Œä¸»è¦æ“…é•¿ç”Ÿæˆä¸­ã€è¿‘æ™¯çš„é£æ ¼åŒ–äººåƒã€‚å®ƒä»¬çš„ä¸»è¦åŠŸèƒ½æ˜¯ä½¿åŸºç¡€æ¨¡å‹å¯ä»¥åœ¨ä¸ä½¿ç”¨ç”»å¸ˆä¸²ã€è¾ƒå°‘çš„è´¨é‡æç¤ºè¯çš„æ¡ä»¶ä¸‹è·å¾—ç›¸å¯¹ç¨³å®šçš„å›¾åƒè´¨é‡ï¼Œä¸ºæç¤ºè¯èŠ‚çº¦tokenç©ºé—´ã€‚
    æœ¬æ¨¡å‹å¹¶éé£æ ¼æ¨¡å‹ï¼Œåœ¨ä¸åŒçš„æç¤ºè¯å’Œç”Ÿæˆæ¡ä»¶ä¸‹å¯èƒ½ä¼šæœ‰å¾®å¦™çš„ç”»é£å·®å¼‚ã€‚

  • Pony: People's Works (ppw) is a experimental fine-tuned model series, approximately 85% of the dataset comes from AI-generated images published by users on CivitAI. Since the earlier ppw dataset was built on images generated by Pony V6, the outputs of this series also carry some characteristics of Pony Diffusion.

  • This series uses standard Danbooru tags and is mainly optimized for generating stylized portraits at medium and close range. The primary effect of this model series is to allow the basemodel to achieve relatively stable image quality, without artist keywords or long quality tags, freeing up token space for prompts.
    These models are not style LoRAs. There may be subtle stylistic variations depending on different prompts and generating conditions.

ç‰ˆæœ¬ä¿¡æ¯ | Version Info.

  • æœ¬é¡µé¢å‘å¸ƒçš„æ˜¯ppwçš„åŸºç¡€æ¨¡å‹ç‰ˆæœ¬ã€‚è¿™äº›æ¨¡å‹ç”±NoobAI-XLè®­ç»ƒå¾—æ¥ï¼Œé¦–è¦åŠŸèƒ½æ˜¯ç”¨äºæå–LoConç‰ˆæœ¬æ¨¡å‹ã€‚é™¤æ­¤ä¹‹å¤–è¿˜ä¼šè¢«ç”¨ä½œä¸‹ä¸€ä»£æ¨¡å‹æŸäº›ç‰¹å®šæ¦‚å¿µè®­ç»ƒæ•°æ®çš„åˆæˆã€‚

  • æ‚¨ä¹Ÿå¯ä»¥æŠŠè¿™ä¸ªæ¨¡å‹å½“åšç”Ÿæˆæ¨¡å‹ç‹¬ç«‹ä½¿ç”¨ï¼Œå¯ä»¥ä¸åŠ è½½LoRAç‹¬ç«‹ç”Ÿæˆå›¾åƒï¼Œå ç”¨æ›´å°‘è®¡ç®—èµ„æºã€‚ç›¸æ¯”LoConç‰ˆæœ¬ï¼ŒåŸºç¡€æ¨¡å‹ç‰ˆæœ¬ç†è®ºä¸Šå¯¹è®­ç»ƒå†…å®¹æœ‰æ›´å¼ºçš„æ³›åŒ–æ€§ï¼Œä½†æ˜¯ä¸å…¶ä»–LoRAã€LyCORISç­‰æ¨¡å‹æ­é…çš„æ•ˆæœå¯èƒ½è¾ƒå·®ã€‚æ²¡æœ‰é’ˆå¯¹çœ¼ç›ã€æ‰‹éƒ¨ç­‰ç»†èŠ‚åšä¼˜åŒ–ã€‚

  • å¯ä»¥ç”¨äºç¡¬ç›˜å‚¨å­˜ç©ºé—´è¾ƒå¤§ä½†æ˜¯æ˜¾å¡æ€§èƒ½æœ‰é™çš„æƒ…å½¢ï¼Œæˆ–è€…éœ€è¦æ›´ç¨³å®šçš„ç”Ÿæˆæ•ˆæœçš„ç”¨æˆ·ã€‚

  • è¯·æ³¨æ„æœ¬æ¨¡å‹ç”Ÿæˆå†…å®¹ä¸å¯ç”¨äºå•†ç”¨ã€‚è¯¦æƒ…è¯·é˜…è¯»NoobAI-XLåŸå§‹è®¸å¯è¯ã€‚

  • This page features the checkpoint versions of ppw. These models were trained from NoobAI-XL and primarily served as the source for extracting the LoCon versions. They are also used to synthesize training data for certain specific concepts in next generation of the ppw models.

  • You can generate images independently without loading any LoRA. It can produce images independently while consuming fewer computational resources.
    Compared to the LoCon version, the checkpoints theoretically offers stronger generalization on the training content, but is less flexible in combination with other LoRA or LyCORIS models.
    It has not been specifically optimized for details such as eyes or hands.

  • It is suitable for situations where disk storage is sufficient but GPU performance is limited, or for users who require more stable generation results.

  • Please note that the outputs generated by this model are not permitted for commercial use.
    For more details, please refer to the original NoobAI-XL license.

é«˜è§„æ ¼ç‰ˆLoCon | High-spec LoCon ver.Â

shiny skin, matte skin, shiny hair,

è¯·æ³¨æ„ï¼Œåœ¨danbooruæ•°æ®é›†ä¸­æœ‰å¾ˆå¤šä¸ªç”¨äºæè¿°â€œç…§ç‰‡â€å’Œâ€œæ¥è¿‘ç…§ç‰‡çš„é£æ ¼â€çš„tagã€‚æˆ‘åœ¨è®­ç»ƒé›†ä¸­ç»Ÿä¸€æ ‡æ³¨è¿™äº›å›¾ç‰‡ä¸ºâ€œphotorealisticâ€ã€‚ä½†æ˜¯ä½¿ç”¨danbooruè®­ç»ƒé›†è®­ç»ƒçš„SDXLæ¨¡å‹å¤§å¤šå¹¶ä¸èƒ½å¾ˆå¥½åœ°ç”»å‡ºå†™å®å›¾åƒï¼Œå› æ­¤â€œphotorealisticâ€åªå»ºè®®åœ¨è¾ƒå°æƒé‡ä¸‹ç”¨äºæ”¹å˜ç”»é¢çš„è‚Œç†ã€‚â€œrealisticâ€å¯ä»¥åœ¨é«˜æƒé‡ä¸‹æ­£å¸¸è¿ä½œã€‚

Please note that Danbooru dataset contains multiple tags to describe "photo" or "photo-like styles". Iâ€™ve tagged all such images as â€œphotorealisticâ€ in dataset.

However, most SDXL models trained on the Danbooru dataset do not render realistic images well. â€œphotorealisticâ€ is only recommended at low weight, where it can help adjust texture rather than create realism images. The â€œrealisticâ€ tag can work properly at higher weight.

æ•°æ®é›†æ¥æºåŠè®¸å¯è¯ | Dataset Source & License

  • æ•°æ®é›†ä¸­æ¯ä¸€å¼ å›¾ç‰‡éƒ½ç»è¿‡ä½œè€…æœ¬äººçš„äººå·¥ç­›é€‰ã€åˆ†ç±»å’Œæ ‡æ³¨ç¼–è¾‘ï¼Œå…¶ä¸­æ•°ç™¾å¼ å›¾ç‰‡ç»è¿‡æ‰‹å·¥ç¼–è¾‘ã€ä¿®æ­£ã€‚

  • æ­¤æ¨¡å‹ä¸ºå…è´¹ã€å¼€æºæ¨¡å‹ï¼Œç”¨æˆ·å¯ä»¥åœ¨ç§äººè®¾å¤‡ä¸Šè‡ªè¡Œéƒ¨ç½²è¯¥æ¨¡å‹ã€‚ä½œè€…å¹¶ä¸ä»æ¨¡å‹å‡ºå”®ä¸­è·å–ä»»ä½•æŠ¥é…¬ã€‚ä½œè€…å¹¶ä¸é™åˆ¶æœ¬ç³»åˆ—æ¨¡å‹ç”¨äºå•†ä¸šç”ŸæˆæœåŠ¡æˆ–è€…ç”Ÿæˆå›¾åƒç”¨äºå•†ä¸šç”¨é€”ï¼Œä½†æ˜¯è¯·æ³¨æ„é…åˆä½¿ç”¨çš„Checkpointå’Œå…¶ä»–LoRAçš„è®¸å¯è¯é™åˆ¶ã€‚

  • æ­¤æ•°æ®é›†ä¸­çº¦90%-95%æ•°æ®ä¸ºAIç”Ÿæˆï¼Œä½†æ˜¯è¯·æ³¨æ„æœ‰çº¦250+å¼ æ”¶é›†è‡ªå…¬å…±åª’ä½“ã€æ–°é—»åª’ä½“å’Œå‡ºç‰ˆç‰©çš„å›¾åƒç”¨äºæ¦‚å¿µè¡¥å……ã€‚æœªæ¥çš„ç‰ˆæœ¬ä¼šé€æ¸æ›´æ›¿ç›¸å…³ç´ æã€‚è¯·æœ‰å•†ç”¨æ„å‘çš„ç”¨æˆ·è‡ªè¡Œæ³¨æ„ç›¸å…³é£é™©ã€‚

    æœ¬æ•°æ®é›†æ²¡æœ‰è®­ç»ƒä»»ä½•ç‹¬ç«‹ç”»å¸ˆçš„æ•°æ®ï¼Œä¹Ÿæ²¡æœ‰æ ‡æ³¨ä»»ä½•ç”»å¸ˆä¿¡æ¯ï¼ˆä¸æ’é™¤AIé”™è¯¯æ ‡æ³¨çš„æƒ…å†µï¼‰ã€‚

  • å¦å¤–ï¼Œæœ¬æ¨¡å‹ä¸å…è®¸ç”¨ä½œé—­æºå•†ç”¨ã€æ¨¡å‹å‡ºå”®ï¼Œä¹Ÿç¦æ­¢ç”¨äºé—­æºå•†ç”¨æ¨¡å‹çš„èåˆã€‚å¯¹äºå¼€æºèåˆæ¨¡å‹ç”¨äºç”ŸæˆæœåŠ¡çš„æƒ…å½¢ä¸åšé™åˆ¶ï¼Œä½†æ˜¯å»ºè®®æ ‡æ³¨èåˆæ¨¡å‹çš„å‡ºå¤„ã€‚

  • Every image in the dataset has been manually selected, categorized, and annotated by the author. Additionally, hundreds of the images have been manually edited and corrected.

  • This model is free and open-source model, allowing users to deploy it on their personal devices. The author does not receive any compensation from selling the model. The author does not impose restrictions on using this model for commercial image generation services or generating images for commercial purposes. However, please be mindful of the license restrictions of the Checkpoint and other LoRAs used alongside this model.

  • Approximately 90%-95% of the dataset consists of AI-generated images. However, around 250+ images have been collected from public media, news outlets, and publications to supplement concepts. Future versions will gradually replace these materials. Users with commercial intentions should be aware of the potential risks.

    This dataset does not include training data from any individual artist, nor does it contain explicit artist attributions (though AI mistagging cannot be entirely ruled out).

  • Additionally, this model is not permitted for use in closed-source commercial applications, model resales, or merged into closed-source commercial models. There are no restrictions on open-source merged models being used for image generation services, but it is recommended to credit the sources of any merged models.

name: UltraVistaNoob
description:
This is an experimental model !!! | è¿™æ˜¯ä¸€ä¸ªå®éªŒæ€§æ¨¡å‹!!!


UltraVistaNoob æ˜¯åŸºäº Noob eps 0.75 çš„é«˜åˆ†è¾¨ç‡æ¨¡å‹ï¼Œä¼˜åŒ–äº†è¶…å®½å±å’Œå¤§å°ºå¯¸å›¾åƒç”Ÿæˆã€‚

æ­¤æ¨¡å‹äº2024å¹´9æœˆå®Œæˆè®­ç»ƒ

UltraVistaNoob is a high-resolution model based on Noob eps 0.6, optimized for ultra-wide screens and large image generation.
This model was trained in September 2024.

ç”±äºè®­ç»ƒé›†ç”»é£å½±å“ï¼Œç”»å¸ˆæ•ˆæœä¼šäº§ç”Ÿåç§»ï¼Œå¹¶ä¸”åœ¨1024x1024åˆ†è¾¨ç‡ä¸‹ç”Ÿæˆæ•ˆæœä¼šæœ‰ç•¥å¾®ä¸‹é™ã€‚

Due to the influence of the training set's style, the artist's effect may be slightly offset, and the generation effect may be slightly reduced at a resolution of 1024x1024.

This model was created out of a sudden urge to improve the background performance of the Noob model, so I selected a lot of high-resolution images with good background details. In order to preserve as much background detail as possible, I trained the model using a resolution of 1536x1536. However, in the end, the experiment found that although the background detail had improved, it was not obvious. But I did get a bonus when training the model:

The model can greatly improve the stability of images with high resolution and high aspect ratio, including background stability and limb stability. Although there are still some limb errors (which I think may also be related to Tag), the frequency has been greatly reduced. The model also improves the face error when the person is far away from the camera (but the error still exists when the person is too far away).
